title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
Hi,
I've tried to figure out the exact model of the board, but I can't find it engraved on the board anywhere.
The only number that I saw was this one on the img, glued on that component, and because i found a boardview with that exact number, I assumed that it was the board number. Isen't it?

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message: That's the lid sensor board number.

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
Hi,
I can't figure out what is the board number. I can't see it anywhere.
However, I'm not sure that the problem is the BIOS.

This mac has green light, fan spin, all the voltages are present, but i get no image (internal nor external), and i don't have USB activity.

The CPU gets hot, and i get all voltages, besides:

PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG = 0V

Can you help?

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/Board_Number_by_A_Number#A1370_MacBook_Air_11.22_MagSafe_1[/URL]
[QUOTE]
[SIZE=5][B]A1370 MacBook Air 11" MagSafe 1[/B][/SIZE]

820-2796 2010 MacBook Air 11"
820-3024 2011 MacBook Air 11"[/QUOTE]

[ATTACH type="full"]60001[/ATTACH]

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
Tks,
It was hiden...
It is 820-3024-B

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
Do you get voltage at L7510?
Check CPUIMVP_PGOOD too.

ALL_SYS_PWRGD, PM_PCH_PWROK, PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK, PLT_RESET_L, all present?

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
Hi,
Yes, i have voltages on  L7510:
1=1V
2= 1.1V

CPUIMVP_PGOOD  = 3.3V

ALL_SYS_PWRGD =3.3V
PM_PCH_PWROK =3.4V
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK =3.3V
PLT_RESET_L =3.3V

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
I've tried the K78 no test.bin, but the result is the same.

With the other one (820-3023), the behavier change. It seams that it tries to boot, the fan spin for 1-2 seconds, and then stops, and keeps like that forever (looping spin and stop), and goes from 200 mA to 30 mA on bench PSU.

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message: Try starting in SMC bypass mode.

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message: SMC bypass doesn't work. Still in reboot

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
Hi,
This BIOS seams to be the correct one (the mac powered on, and rebooted after a while, and stayed powered on normaly after that reboot). 
However, i still don't have any image, internal or external, and no aparent USB activity.
On bench PSU it reaches around 700mA, and stays on (fan spin).

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message: Do you get voltage on both L7510/50?

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message: On L7510 I get 1.1V. On L7550 I get near 0V (0.0010V)

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
Some old boards get AXG voltage directly when boot.
I'm not sure in this case, compare with good board.

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message: I don't have any other board like this one. Is there any other way to be sute? Can I measure something else?

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
At least resistance to ground at L7550.
I can only think about bad CPU.
Of course, could be just a simple corroded resistor somewhere.

Just in case, check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
Do the same for the LPC bus resistors.

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
L7550 has 15 ohms to ground (similar to L7510).
All  SPI Bus Series Termination resistors  are OK.
LPC bus resistors  are ok

title: A1370 820-2855-A CLEAN ME
message:
Then bad PCH, CPU, or underneath corrosion.
Heat them with quality flux.
